member.name: T:Ipfs.Base32
member.summary: A codec for Base-32.

remarks.para: A codec for Base-32, and . Adds the extension method to encode a byte array and to decode a Base-32 string.

members.member:
Converts an array of 8-bit unsigned integers to its equivalent string representation that is encoded with base-32 characters. s
An array of 8-bit unsigned integers.
The string representation, in base 32, of the contents of .

member.name: M:Ipfs.Base32.ToBase32(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts an array of 8-bit unsigned integers to its equivalent string representation that is encoded with base-32 digits.
member.param: An array of 8-bit unsigned integers.
member.returns: The string representation, in base 32, of the contents of .

member.name: M:Ipfs.Base32.Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified , which encodes binary data as base 32 digits, to an equivalent 8-bit unsigned integer array.
member.param: The base 32 string to convert.
member.returns: An array of 8-bit unsigned integers that is equivalent to .

member.name: M:Ipfs.Base32.FromBase32(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified , which encodes binary data as base 32 digits, to an equivalent 8-bit unsigned integer array.
member.param: The base 32 string to convert.
member.returns: An array of 8-bit unsigned integers that is equivalent to .

member.name: T:Ipfs.Base58
member.summary: A codec for IPFS Base-58.

remarks.para: A codec for Base-58, and . Adds the extension method to encode a byte array and to decode a Base-58 string.
This is just thin wrapper of .
This codec uses the BitCoin alphabet not Flickr's.

members.member:
Converts an array of 8-bit unsigned integers to its equivalent string representation that is encoded with base-58 characters. s
An array of 8-bit unsigned integers.
The string representation, in base 58, of the contents of .

member.summary: Converts an array of 8-bit unsigned integers to its equivalent string representation that is encoded with base-58 digits.
member.param: An array of 8-bit unsigned integers.
member.returns: The string representation, in base 58, of the contents of .

member.name: M:Ipfs.Base58.Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified , which encodes binary data as base 58 digits, to an equivalent 8-bit unsigned integer array.
member.param: The base 58 string to convert.
member.returns: An array of 8-bit unsigned integers that is equivalent to .

member.name: M:Ipfs.Base58.FromBase58(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified , which encodes binary data as base 58 digits, to an equivalent 8-bit unsigned integer array.
member.param: The base 58 string to convert.
member.returns: An array of 8-bit unsigned integers that is equivalent to .

member.name: T:Ipfs.Cid
member.summary: Identifies some content, e.g. a Content ID.

remarks.para: A Cid is a self-describing content-addressed identifier for distributed systems.
Initially, IPFS used a as the CID and this is still supported as 0. Version 1 adds a self describing structure to the multi-hash, see the spec.
remarks.note: The hashing algorithm must be "sha2-256" for a version 0 CID.

member.name: F:Ipfs.Cid.DefaultContentType
member.summary: The default , "dag-pb".

member.name: P:Ipfs.Cid.Version
member.summary: The version of the CID.

member.name: P:Ipfs.Cid.Encoding
member.summary: The encoding of the CID.

member.name: P:Ipfs.Cid.ContentType
member.summary: The content type or format of the data being addressed.
member.value: dag-pb, dag-cbor, eth-block, etc. Defaults to "dag-pb".

member.name: P:Ipfs.Cid.Hash
member.summary: The cryptographic hash of the content being addressed.
member.value: The of the content being addressed.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Cid.ToString
member.summary: A CID that is readable by a human.
member.returns: e.g. "base58btc cidv0 dag-pb sha2-256 Qm..."

member.name: M:Ipfs.Cid.Encode
member.summary: Converts the CID to its equivalent string representation.
member.returns: The string representation of the .
member.remarks: For 0, this is equalivalent to the base58btc encoding of the .

member.name: M:Ipfs.Cid.Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the specified to an equivalent object.
member.param: The CID encoded string.
member.returns: A new that is equivalent to .
member.exception: When the can not be decoded.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Cid.Read(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads the binary representation of the CID from the specified .
member.param: The to read from.
member.returns: A new .

member.name: M:Ipfs.Cid.Write(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Writes the binary representation of the CID to the specified .
member.param: The to write to.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Cid.Read(Google.Protobuf.CodedInputStream)
member.summary: Reads the binary representation of the CID from the specified .
member.param: The to read from.
member.returns: A new .

member.name: M:Ipfs.Cid.Write(Google.Protobuf.CodedOutputStream)
member.summary: Writes the binary representation of the CID to the specified .
member.param: The to write to.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Cid.op_Implicit(Ipfs.MultiHash)~Ipfs.Cid
member.summary: Implicit casting of a to a .
member.param: A .
member.returns: A new based on the . A 0 CID is returned if the is "sha2-356"; otherwise 1.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Cid.op_Equality(Ipfs.Cid,Ipfs.Cid)
member.summary: Value equality.

member.name: M:Ipfs.Cid.op_Inequality(Ipfs.Cid,Ipfs.Cid)
member.summary: Value inequality.

member.summary: Implicit casting of a to a .
member.param: A string encoded Cid.
member.returns: A new .
member.remarks: Equivalent to Cid.Decode(s)

member.summary: Implicit casting of a to a .
member.param: A Cid.
member.returns: A new .
member.remarks: Equivalent to Cid.Encode()

member.name: T:Ipfs.CoreApi.IBitswapApi
member.summary: Interact with the bitswap agent.

remarks.note: Not yet ready for prime time.

member.name: T:Ipfs.CoreApi.IBlockApi
member.summary: Manages IPFS blocks.
member.remarks:
An IPFS Block is a byte sequence that represents an IPFS Object (i.e. serialized byte buffers). It is useful to talk about them as "blocks" in Bitswap and other things that do not care about what is being stored.
It is also possible to store arbitrary stuff using ipfs block put/get as the API does not check for proper IPFS Object formatting.
This may be very good or bad, we haven't decided yet ðŸ˜„

member.name: M:Ipfs.CoreApi.IBlockApi.GetAsync(Ipfs.Cid,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Gets a IPFS block.
member.param: Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
The of the block.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous get operation. The task's value contains the block's id and data.

member.name: M:Ipfs.CoreApi.IBlockApi.PutAsync(System.Byte[],System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Stores a byte array as a IPFS block.
member.param: The byte array to send to the IPFS network.
The content type or format of the ; such as "raw" or "dag-db". See for more details.
The algorithm name used to produce the .
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous put operation. The task's value is the block's .

member.name: M:Ipfs.CoreApi.IBlockApi.PutAsync(System.IO.Stream,System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Stores a stream as a IPFS block.
member.param: The of data to send to the IPFS network.
The content type or format of the ; such as "raw" or "dag-db". See for more details.
The algorithm name used to produce the .
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous put operation. The task's value is the block's .

member.name: M:Ipfs.CoreApi.IBlockApi.StatAsync(Ipfs.Cid,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Information on a IPFS block.
member.param: The of the block.
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task's value contains the block's id and size.

member.name: M:Ipfs.CoreApi.IBlockApi.RemoveAsync(Ipfs.Cid,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Remove a IPFS block.
member.param: Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
The of the block.
If true do not raise exception when does not exist. Default value is false.
member.returns: The awaited Task will return the deleted or null if the does not exist and is true.
member.remarks: This removes the block from the local cache and does not affect other peers.

member.name: T:Ipfs.CoreApi.INameApi
member.summary: Manages the IPNS (Interplanetary Name Space).
member.remarks: IPNS is a PKI namespace, where names are the hashes of public keys, and the private key enables publishing new(signed) values. In both and , the default name used is the node's own , which is the hash of its public key.

member.name: M:Ipfs.CoreApi.INameApi.PublishAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Nullable{System.TimeSpan},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Publish an IPFS name.
member.param: The CID or path to the content to publish.
Resolve before publishing. Defaults to true.
The local key name used to sign the content. Defauts to "self".
Duration that the record will be valid for. Defaults to 24 hours.
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task's value is the of the published content.

member.name: M:Ipfs.CoreApi.INameApi.ResolveAsync(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Resolve an IPNS name.
member.param: An IPNS address, such as: /ipns/ipfs.io or a CID.
Resolve until the result is not an IPNS name. Defaults to false.
Do not use cached entries. Defaulst to false.
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task's value is the resolved .

member.summary: Manage pinned objects (locally stored and permanent).

member.summary: Adds an IPFS object to the pinset and also stores it to the IPFS repo. pinset is the set of hashes currently pinned (not gc'able).
member.param: A CID or path to an existing object, such as "QmXarR6rgkQ2fDSHjSY5nM2kuCXKYGViky5nohtwgF65Ec/about" or "QmZTR5bcpQD7cFgTorqxZDYaew1Wqgfbd2ud9QqGPAkK2V"
true to recursively pin links of the object; otherwise, false to only pin the specified object. Default is true.
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task's value is a sequence of that were pinned.

member.name: M:Ipfs.CoreApi.IPinApi.ListAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: List all the objects pinned to local storage.
member.param: Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task's value is a sequence of .

member.name: M:Ipfs.CoreApi.IPinApi.RemoveAsync(Ipfs.Cid,System.Boolean,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Unpin an object.
member.param: The CID of the object.
true to recursively unpin links of object; otherwise, false to only unpin the specified object. Default is true.
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task's value is a sequence of that were unpinned.

member.name: T:Ipfs.CoreApi.IPubSubApi
member.summary: Allows you to publish messages to a given topic, and also to subscribe to new messages on a given topic.

remarks.para: This is an experimental feature. It is not intended in its current state to be used in a production environment.
To use, the daemon must be run with '--enable-pubsub-experiment'.

member.name: M:Ipfs.CoreApi.IPubSubApi.SubscribedTopicsAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Get the subscribed topics.
member.param: Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task's value is a sequence of for each topic.

member.name: M:Ipfs.CoreApi.IPubSubApi.PeersAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Get the peers that are pubsubing with us.
member.param: When specified, only peers pubsubing on the topic are returned.
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task's value is a sequence of .

member.name: M:Ipfs.CoreApi.IPubSubApi.Publish(System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Publish a message to a given topic.
member.param: The topic name.
The message to publish.
Is used to stop the task. When cancelled, the is raised.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Ipfs.CoreApi.IPubSubApi.Subscribe(System.String,System.Action{Ipfs.IPublishedMessage},System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Subscribe to messages on a given topic.
member.param: The topic name.
The action to perform when a is received.
Is used to stop the topic listener. When cancelled, the is NOT raised.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
member.remarks: The is invoked on the topic listener thread.

member.name: T:Ipfs.IDataBlock
member.summary: Some data that is stored in IPFS.

A DataBlock has an unique ID and some data ( or ).
It is useful to talk about them as "blocks" in Bitswap and other things that do not care about what is being stored.

member.name: T:Ipfs.MultiAddress
member.summary: A standard way to represent a networks address that supports multiple network protocols.
member.remarks:
A multi address emphasizes explicitness, self-description, and portability. It allows applications to treat addresses as opaque tokens which avoids making assumptions about the address representation (e.g. length).
A multi address is represented as a series of protocol codes and values pairs. For example, an IPFS file at a sepcific address over ipv4 and tcp is "/ip4/10.1.10.10/tcp/29087/ipfs/QmVcSqVEsvm5RR9mBLjwpb2XjFVn5bPdPL69mL8PH45pPC".
Value type equality is implemented.

member.remarks: There is no specification that describes the agent version string. The default is "unknown/0.0".

member.summary: The name and version of the supported IPFS protocol.
member.remarks: There is no specification that describes the protocol version string. The default is "unknown/0.0".

member.name: T:Ipfs.Registry.HashingAlgorithm
member.summary: Metadata and implemetations of an IPFS hashing algorithm.
member.remarks:
IPFS assigns a unique and to hashing algorithm. See for the currently defined hashing algorithms.
These algorithms are supported: sha1, sha2-256, sha2-512, keccak-224, keccak-256, keccak-384, keccak-512, sha3-224, sha3-256, sha3-384, sha3-512, shake-128 and shake-256.

member.name: T:Ipfs.Registry.MultiBaseAlgorithm
member.summary: Metadata and implemetations of an IPFS multi-base algorithm.
member.remarks:
IPFS assigns a unique and to multi-base algorithm. See for the currently defined multi-base algorithms.
These algorithms are supported: base58btc, base58flickr, base64, base64pad, base64url, base16, base32, base32pad, base32hex and base32hexpad.

member.name: T:Ipfs.Varint
member.summary: A codec for a variable integer.
member.remarks:
A VarInt is encoded in network byte order (Big Endian). Each byte (except the last) contains 7 bits of information with the most significant bit set to 1. The last byte has MSB set to 0.
Negative values are not allowed. When encountered a is thrown.
Adds the following extension methods to

member.param: The value to convert.
member.returns: A byte array representing the as a variable integer.

member.param: A positive integer value.
member.returns: The number of bytes required to encode the value.
